ResourceHeader.ResourceName: Van Allen Probe B Spinfit DC Electric Field estimates level-2 in M-GSE coordinates

RevisionEvent.Note: Only known prior ReleaseDate of the metadata

ResourceHeader.Description: This data set contains spinfit DC Electric Field estimates in M-GSE coordinates that are measured by the Electric Field and Waves Suite (EFW) onboard Van Allen Probe A. One 2D vector estimate of the E-field is computed at a cadence of once per spin period (typically 10.7 to 11.1 s) using the survey E-field data product - the potential difference between EFW sensors V1 and V2 (E12) sampled at a nominal rate of 32 samp/s with a resolution of 16 bits. The X-component of the E-field estimate, corresponding to the axial component in the spacecraft coordinate system, is set to zero in this data product. See the EFW-FAQ (http://rbsp.space.umn.edu/efw_faq.html) for a discussion of this convention for this data product. The VxB electric field in the spacecraft frame due to orbital motion of the spacecraft around the Earth as computed from the spacecraft orbital velocity and measured B-field in the spacraft frame has been subtracted from the measured electric field, and so the data product is in the quasi-inertial frame equivalent to GSE (i.e. it is NOT in the corotation frame of the Earth!). Each spin fit is time-tagged with the time corresponding to the middle of the spin of data that went into the spin fit algorithm; in other words, if a given spin covers the interval (t1, t2), then the spin fit E-field estimate associated with that spin is given the time tag 0.5*(t1 + t2). The root mean square residual between the data included in the fit and the resulting best-fit model, sigma, and the final number of points included in the spin fit, npts, are also provided at spin-period cadence. The nominal dynamic range of the E-field estimate is +/- 1 V/m in any component.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: NASA Space Physics Data Facility (SPDF) CDAWeb.

Parameter.Name: Spinfit E-field in MGSE (near GSE)
Parameter.Description: Spinfit E-field in MGSE (autoscale, VxB subtracted, i.e. near GSE)
Parameter.Caveats: Spin-fit electric field esimate in the MGSE coordinate system and GSE frame (VxB subtracted) derived from the EFW e12 (V1-V2) data product.

Parameter.Name: Spinfit E-field in MGSE (near GSE)
Parameter.Description: Spinfit E-field in MGSE (fixedscale, VxB subtracted, i.e. near GSE)
Parameter.Caveats: Spin-fit electric field esimate in the MGSE coordinate system and GSE frame (VxB subtracted) derived from the EFW e12 (V1-V2) data product.

Parameter.Name: sigma12_spinfit_mgse
Parameter.Description: The sigma of the spin fit of each spin period from boom V12.
Parameter.Caveats: The sigma of the spin fit of each spin period from boom V12.

Parameter.Name: npoints12_spinfit_mgse
Parameter.Description: Number of points used in a spin fit of one spin period from boom V12.
Parameter.Caveats: Number of points used in a spin fit of one spin period from boom V12.

Parameter.Name: VxB E-field in M-GSE coordinates.
Parameter.Caveats: Electric field due to VxB, where V is spacecraft velocity and B is the measured ambient magnetic field.

Parameter.Name: Configuration (HSK) timetags, UTC
Parameter.Caveats: Configuration timetags. Used for BEB and DFB config values.

Parameter.Name: EFW BEB Configuration
Parameter.Description: EFW Boom Electronics Board (BEB) configuration code (on-board sensor biases
Parameter.Caveats: Indicates the configuration of the EFW Boom Electronics Board (BEB). Encodes the following information: for each sensor, sensor current bias, usher and guard voltage bias. See EFW-FAQ (http://rbsp.space.umn.edu/efw_faq.html) for a detailed description of the mapping between code value and instrument configuration (not crucial for L2 data interpretation)..

Parameter.Name: EFW DFB Configuration
Parameter.Description: EFW Digital Fields Board (DFB) Configuration code (on-board spectral and waveform processing configuration)
Parameter.Caveats: Indicates the configuration of the EFW Digital Filter Board (DFB). Encodes the following information: assignment of analog input channels to the various on-board spectral processors (FBK, SPEC, XSPEC); parameters of the on-board B-field-aligned data processing; nominal or contingency multiplexer programming. See EFW-FAQ (http://rbsp.space.umn.edu/efw_faq.html) for a detailed description of the mapping from code value to instrument configuration (not crucial for L2 data interpretation)..

Parameter.Name: Time, UTC
Parameter.Caveats: The elements of efw_qual are determined on a fixed cadence regardless of the nominal cadence of the individual L2 data products, and epoch_qual provides storage for those fixed-cadence time tags..

Parameter.Name: EFW Data Quality Flags
Parameter.Description: EFW quality array (global estimate of EFW data quality, plus 13 underlying observatory and instrument-level data quality factors)

Parameter.Name: EFW Quality Flags Components
Parameter.Description: Component numbers for EFW data quality flags, efw_qual..
